did.unittitle: New York City Board of Education Fact Finding Committee Report

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: New York City Board of Education

did.abstract: Report of the Fact Finding Committee : briefs and transcripts, 1951.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The Fact-Finding Committee composed of Mr. Arthur S.
Meyer, Chairman, Mrs. Elinore M. Herrick, Joseph D.

Clauson, Jr. and Vito F. Lanza was appointed by the Board of Education on October 3, 1950 to consider in all their phases any questions deemed by it to be relevant in respect to teachers' salaries and the matter of extra-curricular and co-curricular activities, responsibilities or duties as a result of wide spread protests from both teachers and the public on salary schedules and a boycott of extracurricular activities by. the teachers.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to the collections in the Kheel Center is restricted. Please contact a reference archivist for access to these materials.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: This collection must be used in keeping with the Kheel Center Information Sheet and Procedures for Document Use.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: New York City Board of Education Fact Finding Committee Report #5111. Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation and Archives, Cornell University Library.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Related Collections: 5104: Rochester Transit Company Arbitration Files 5231: Arthur S. Meyer Papers 5252: Arthur Meyer Papers
